newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA 8-YEAR BOND YIELD WITHIN MARKET EXPECTATIONS.
newsitem.headline: INDIA 8-YEAR BOND YIELD WITHIN MARKET EXPECTATIONS.

text.p: Money market dealers said a cut-off yield of 11.19 percent at Monday's auction of eight year bonds met market expectations.
"It is within an acceptable band...close to market expectations," said a dealer at the Indian affiliate of a U.S. investment firm.
He said the new paper is expected to be quoted at about 40 paise above the issue price. "But right now there is not much demand," he said.

"There would be sellers at 50 paise premium," said a dealer at a major bank. But he said there may not be buyers at this price. "In any case, I don't expect many transactions in this paper," he added.
The auction, to raise 30 billion rupees for the government, received 466 bids for 98.44 billion rupees.
The RBI said it accepted 87 bids for 30 billion rupees.
